tourName: Buddhist Bhutan cultural tour, Black necked Crane Festival
generalInfo:
Embark on a captivating journey through Bhutan, immersing yourself in its vibrant Buddhist culture and picturesque mountain landscapes. Arrive in Paro, either by flight or overland from India, and proceed to the enchanting capital, Thimphu, where a multitude of cultural wonders awaits. Explore the wilderness of Phobjika Valley in Gangtey, and attend the colourful Black-Necked Crane Festival, held in honour of these majestic birds' migration from Tibet. Continue your expedition to the dramatic valleys of Bumthang in central Bhutan, engaging in rural walks and village visits. As you journey eastward, witness the stunning landscapes and cultural richness that characterize this region. Begin your return journey, passing through Trongsa to reach Punakha, home to one of Bhutan's most striking dzongs. Take a memorable stroll through paddy fields to reach the enlightening Temple of Fertility. Conclude your adventure in Paro, where you can visit the ancient Kyichu Lhakang temple dating back to the 7th century. Cap off your exploration with a hike to the iconic Tiger's Nest monastery, creating lasting memories of Bhutan's unparalleled beauty and cultural treasures.

**Pre-extension through Bengal from Kolkata through Darjeeling including highlights of the Kali Puja and Diwali festivals is available as a small group trip

TOUR HIGHLIGHTS
Sacred sites in Paro valley
Enjoy the wonderful Black Necked Crane Festiavl
Bhutanese art & culture in museums of Thimphu
See the largest published book in the world
Marvel at the gigantic golden Buddha statue at Buddha Point
Rural walks in remote valleys and mountain passes
Explore Bumthang's valleys by foot
Drink tea and eat with villagers.
Visit the Temple of Fertility in Punakha
Hike up to the iconic Tiger's Nest monastery

PLACES VISITED
Thimphu - Paro - Buddha Point - Gangtey - Dochula Pass - Phobjikha Valley - Bumthang - Punakha

WHAT'S INCLUDED
Bhutan visa
Arrival & departure transfers
Ground transport with driver
Accommodation
Meals on full board basis
Expertise of an escorted English-speaking guide
Entrance fees to sites & parks

dayInfo.description: On arrival in Paro, you will be met by a travel representative and transferred to Thimphu. On arrival in Thimphu check in to your hotel, before an evening guided walk around Thimphu Main Street and market area. Overnight Thimphu.

All day sightseeing in one of the world's most alluring and enigmatic capitals. Thimphu's small stature, scenic backdrop, and philosophy of spiritual fulfillment over cash and consumerism makes it a wonderful choice for a day at large discovering another side to urban life. In the morning head into Thimphu Valley, where we've lined up visits to the Buddha Point, Changangkha Lhakang and the lively weekend market. In the afternoon, change tack and go to a 500 year-old monastery called Pangri Zampa, the Buddhist monastery of Tashichho Dzong on the west bank of the Wang Chu. End at the King's Memorial Chorten in the town centre, before returing to your hotel for relax and dine in. Overnight in Thimphu

Before setting off for Gangtey, visit the Textile Museum and the Simply Bhutan open-air living museum. Afterwards drive to Gangtey, en-route visiting the Dochla Pass (at an altitude of 3080m). On arrival in Gangtey, check-in to your hotel before an afternoon walk around Gangtey village, visiting Gangtey Goempa, the only Nyingmapa monastery in this region. Overnight in Gangtey.

Spend half a day experiencing the Black-Necked Crane festival at the Gangtey Gompa. The festival celebrates the arrival of the rare black-necked cranes to this region from Tibet. Join the local people at the gompa in the morning to witness the colourful masked dances and festivities. Afterwards, rest of the day is free at leisure to walk around Phobjika valley to see the birds at close quarter. Overnight in Gangtey

After breakfast we set off to Bumthang, heading up and up until crossing the Pele-la pass at 3300m above sea level. Descend the pass, stopping off for lunch in Trongsa and visit both the Trongsa Dzong and Ta Dzong. This afternoon, continue your journey onward to Bumthang, ascending yet another high mountain pass, the Yutong-la, at 3400m above sea level. Breathe again in the beautiful Bumthang Highlands where you'll check in to your resort and look forward to dinner. Overnight in Bumthang

Whole day dedicated to explorations in this heavenly highland region. Kick off with a tour of the Bumthang Valley. Actually comprising four distinct valleys - Chumney, Choekhor, Tang and Ura - this seldom-visited gem in the geographical heart of the kingdom simply oozes timeless charm. Todayâ€™s sightseeing includes visit to ancient temples of Jambay Lhakhang, Kurje Lhakhang & Tamshing Lhakhang. Later visit Jakar Dzong, the fortress which also serves as the administrative centre of the district. End on a high note with a special visit to the Bumthang Brewery & Swiss Cheese Factory. Overnight in Bumthang

Today is a travel day. After breakfast, leave Bumthang on a lengthy but scenic drive to the Punakha Valley. On arrival in the old capital, Punakha, proceed to your hillside hotel. Settle in and enjoy the panoramic beauty of the valley surroundings. Dine in-house. Overnight in Punakha

Explore this heavenly river valley, starting after breakfast at the Punakha Dzong, a 17th century fortress at the confluence of the Pho and Mo Chhu rivers. Next to Chimi Lhakhang, a hilltop monastery founded in 1499. Enjoy lunch followed by a vigorous stroll through the rice and chilli fields running alongside the Mo Chhu, up to Khamsum Yulley Namgyal Chorten, a stupa of superstitious origins that commands a stunning view over the Punakha Valley. Return to your hotel before dark and dine in. Overnight in Punakha.

The journey continues this morning to Paro, visiting Simtokha Dzong en-route. On arrival in Paro, check-in to your hotel. This afternoon, visit Ta Dzong, and stroll down the trail to visit Rinpung Dzong. Overnight in Paro.

Lace up your boots for an excursion to Taktshang Monastery, also known as the Tiger's Nest (approx 5 hours walking tour). After lunch we proceed to the ruins of Drukgyel Dzong, followed by a visit to Kyichu Lhakhang in the evening. Overnight in Paro.
At an appropriate time, you will be transferred to the airport for your flight home, or maybe onward to new pastures.
